column3:
Competency Question /
 Natural language sentence (fact)
What are the attributes of an organisation?
column4: Identifier, business identifier, location, skin color, avatar, notes, creation date, update date

column3: An organisation can contain notifications
An organisation can contain audits
An organisation is related to users
An organisation can contain nodes
An organisation can have a partnership with another organisation
A partnership is requested by an organisation
A partnership is requested to an organisation
What are the attributes related to a notification?
column4: Identifier, owner, actor, target, object, type, status, creation date

column3: A notification can be caused by an actor
A notification can affect a target
A notification needs an object
Examples of notification status are: Waiting, Info, Accepted, Rejected and Responded
A notification can be read
Types of a notification can be: registrationRequest, itemEnabled, itemDisabled, itemDiscovered, contractRequest, itemUpdated,contractAccepted
What are the attributes related to a node?
column4: name, status, creation date, update date, token auth, public key

column3: A node has an AURORAL identifier
A node belongs to an organisation
Examples of node types are: vicinity, sharq, auroral
A node contains items
A node can have two status: active or deleted
What are the attributes of an item?
column4: name, status, creation date, update date

column3: An item has an AURORAL identifier
An item is contained in a node
An item is related to a user
An item belongs to an organisation
An item can be represented with an avatar
Types of an item privacy policy can be: public, for friends, private
An item can be a device
An item can be a service
Types of an item status can be: disabled, enabled, deleted
What are the attributes related to a user?
column4: name, first name, last name, email, contact mail, occupation, location, status, creation date, update date

column3: A user has an AURORAL identifier
A user belongs to an organisation
A user can be represented with an avatar
Types of an user visibility policy can be: public, for friends, private
Types of user status can be: active, deleted
A user can be associated to a role
Types of roles can be: admin, user, infrastructure operator, service provider, device owner, system integrator, super user, dev ops
A user contain can contain a notification
A user can contain an audit
A user can contain an item
